intro: Dudleya brevipes, commonly known as the shortfoot liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming structure. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. Dudleya brevipes is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
